title: WJ Sexten Farmers Forum Grazing Presentation 2012

tasks.task: Implementing grazing wedge management for pasture optimization.
subtasks: Using forage inventory tools (yardstick, sonar, etc.) to measure pasture growth.
Tracking pasture growth visually using the grazing wedge concept (red, yellow, green zones).
Adjusting grazing schedules based on pasture maturity and quality to maintain optimal forage quality.
Calculating forage availability and planning supplementation needs.
Evaluating forage digestibility and utilizing grazing wedge for optimal harvest timing.
Matching livestock needs (e.g., gestating vs. lactating cows) to forage quality and quantity.
Monitoring and adjusting fertilizer application based on grazing wedge data.
Conducting fall inventory to estimate hay needs and manage feed resources.

tasks.task: Presenting the grazing wedge concept for sustainable forage management.
subtasks: Explaining the grazing wedge's purpose as a visual forage inventory tool.
Demonstrating how to measure pastures using various technologies (e.g., yardstick, sonar meters).
Showing examples of how grazing wedge visualizations identify optimal and overgrazed pastures.
Educating producers on forage quality monitoring and adjusting grazing patterns accordingly.
Presenting data on forage growth rates and their implications for inventory management.
Highlighting the role of cattle prioritization in grazing management (e.g., pregnant, lactating, growing).
Discussing the economic benefits of proactive forage management through grazing wedge implementation.
Inviting questions and addressing specific challenges (e.g., hay production timing, feed scarcity planning).
